channel.title: Why is it that my client will not load the "Open" option with this box set?

item.title: Why is it that my client will not load the "Open" option with this box set?
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

In the snippets section i posted how to get rid of the Dwarf remains null thing if you dont put anything as a first click (Snippets of client hacking) and then just use the item on item packet in your server to make it work with a chisel

Read full topic
item.source: Why is it that my client will not load the "Open" option with this box set?

item.title: Why is it that my client will not load the "Open" option with this box set?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Your most likely using a wield int for the set, even though you named it ‘open’ the client doesnt know what this means and it most likely tries to equip the box set instead of opening it, since there are no wield ints it freezes your client, i suggest getting the ints from a different object, such as a hammer or something that only has the ‘use’ option.
You could always add a method server sided for if you use a chisel with the box set it gives you the ahrim’s set.
this is the easiest fix i can think of for i know nothing about clients.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is it that my client will not load the "Open" option with this box set?
item.dc:creator: @Michaelmmm Michaelmmm
item.description:
@Michaelmmm wrote:

Ok well i have this ahrims box set and i give it the “option” to “open” in the class 8 but when i run it with the option it freezes the client, but when i delete the option if “unfreezes” and shows the box set fine? whats the problem, please help!

}
if(i == 7501)
{
class8.aString170 = “Ahrim’s set”;
class8.aStringArray189[2] = “Open”; ----this is the option that is the problem for me >_<??
class8.aStringArray168 = null;
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.anInt174 = 14090;
class8.anInt165 = -1;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt202 = 0;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.anInt198 = 1795;
class8.anInt181 = 2414;
class8.anInt155 = 20;
class8.anInt200 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt169 = 6;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = -22;
class8.anInt179 = 11847;
class8.anInt190 = 199;
class8.aByteArray178 = “It’s a Barrows - ahrim’s set.”.getBytes();
